definition: appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
(coll.) to look every bit the big star

sentences.english: ‘I knew we would be laughed at for putting credence in astrology, ’ says Catherine.
sentences.chinese: “我知道我們相信星相學會被人嘲笑，”凱瑟琳說。

sentences.english: Taurus belongs to a group of signs which astrologers call earth signs.
sentences.chinese: 金牛座屬於被星相學家命名的一組土象星座。

sentences.english: Cancer belongs to a group of signs which astrologers call water signs.
sentences.chinese: 巨蟹座屬於星相學家們定義的水象星座。

definition: aspect of the celestial bodies (used for navigation and astrology)
meteorological or astronomical phenomenon (e.g. rainbow or eclipse)
seven heavenly bodies and four imaginary stars (in astrology and feng shui)
Zi Wei Dou Shu, a form of Chinese fortune-telling
constellation (arch., now 星座)/one of the 28 constellations of traditional Chinese astronomy and astrology/motion of stars since one's birth (predetermining one's fate in astrology)
to divine using the trigrams/fortune telling
